Package ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.Navigation
  • public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
    The Navigation class is used to make the robot navigate around the playing field.

      • moveStraightForWithCorrection

        public static void moveStraightForWithCorrection​(double distance,
                                                 double destAngle)
        Moves the robot straight for the given distance with correction mid-way for distances greater than 5
        Parameters:
        distance - in feet (tile sizes), may be negative
        destAngle - used to correct the robot orientation

      • forward

        public static void forward()
        Moves the robot forward for an indeterminate distance.

      • backward

        public static void backward()
        Moves the robot backward for an indeterminate distance.

      • turnBy

        public static void turnBy​(double angle)
        Turns the robot by a specified angle. Note that this method is different from turnTo(). For example, if the robot is facing 90 degrees, calling turnBy(90) will make the robot turn to 180 degrees, but calling turnTo(90) should do nothing (since the robot is already at 90 degrees).
        Parameters:
        angle - the angle by which to turn, in degrees

      • clockwise

        public static void clockwise()
        Rotates motors clockwise.

      • counterclockwise

        public static void counterclockwise()
        Rotates motors counterclockwise.

      • stopMotors

        public static void stopMotors()
        Stops both motors. This also resets the motor speeds to zero.

      • convertDistance

        public static int convertDistance​(double distance)
        Converts input distance to the total rotation of each wheel needed to cover that distance.
        Parameters:
        distance - the input distance in meters
        Returns:
        the wheel rotations necessary to cover the distance in degrees

      • convertAngle

        public static int convertAngle​(double angle)
        Converts input angle to total rotation of each wheel needed to rotate robot by that angle.
        Parameters:
        angle - the input angle in degrees
        Returns:
        the wheel rotations (in degrees) necessary to rotate the robot by the angle

      • setSpeed

        public static void setSpeed​(int speed)
        Sets the speed of both motors to the same values.
        Parameters:
        speed - the speed in degrees per second

      • setSpeeds

        public static void setSpeeds​(int leftSpeed,
                             int rightSpeed)
        Sets the speed of both motors to different values.
        Parameters:
        leftSpeed - the speed of the left motor in degrees per second
        rightSpeed - the speed of the right motor in degrees per second

      • setAcceleration

        public static void setAcceleration​(int acceleration)
        Sets the acceleration of both motors.
        Parameters:
        acceleration - the acceleration in degrees per second squared
